intro: Chaerophyllum astrantiae, commonly known as the starry cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, giving it a delicate and airy appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to gardens and natural habitats.
